newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-ENGLAND CALL EMERGENCY MEETING OF IRB.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-ENGLAND CALL EMERGENCY MEETING OF IRB.

text.p: England have called an emergency meeting of the International Rugby Football Board next Tuesday after the latest impasse between the Rugby Football Union (RFU) and the leading clubs.
The English Professional Rugby Union Clubs (EPRUC), which represents the leading English clubs, will not release its players for a series of tour matches over the next month.
The two sides have been locked in an acrimonious dispute over television rights, control of the game and shareout of money.
RFU secretary Tony Hallett said: "We want to ensure that our proposed agreement with the clubs is acceptable to the International Board."
Cliff Brittle, chairman of the RFU's executive committee, added: "We need to be clear that only the RFU can be in control of the game in this country and not representatives from the leading clubs.
"We have to comply with IB laws and the EPRUC clubs cannot take overall control of competitions and sponsorship."
